page.title: 04SHOPPING
page.content: VILLAGE SHOPS UMBERLEIGH: The shop is near the RIVER TAW. The owner said the most popular sweets were Kit-kats and Mars bars. General stock includes fruit and many household items. Originally built in the 17th century the building used to be a church. The owner sells 75 papers on Sunday but not so many during the week. There have been tourists in the shop but not very many-about 40 per week. The village shop in CHITTLEHAMPTON sells many household items and fresh meat which Umberleigh does not. 20-25 tourists visit in a normal week during the holiday season. There is also a lovely florist shop in Chittlehampton. See also GUEST HOUSE and INN UMBERLEIGH.
